name: Breakbeat
description: Syncopated drum patterns (breakbeats), generally driving the groove at 110-160 BPM, emerging in the late 1980s from sampling drum breaks, before forming an umbrella genre separate from Drum and Bass, Downtempo, and Hip Hop.

children.name: Acid Breaks
children.description: Incorporates prominent "squelching", resonant low pass filter sounds typical to Acid House, and often other "trippy" effects into intense, syncopated, broken rhythms in the tempos of 110-150 BPM.

children.name: Acid Breaks
children.description: Incorporates prominent "squelching", resonant low pass filter sounds typical to Acid House, and often other "trippy" effects into intense, syncopated, broken rhythms in the tempos of 110-150 BPM.

children.name: Baltimore Club
children.description: Drew on the "booty bass" syncopation of Miami Bass, combined with Breakbeat rhythms around 130 BPM and chopped up vocal samples as found in Ghetto House.

children.name: Baltimore Club
children.description: Drew on the "booty bass" syncopation of Miami Bass, combined with Breakbeat rhythms around 130 BPM and chopped up vocal samples as found in Ghetto House.

children.name: Big Beat
children.description: Popular in Britain during the late 1990s, driven by edited breakbeats and prominent basslines.

children.name: Big Beat
children.description: Popular in Britain during the late 1990s, driven by edited breakbeats and prominent basslines.

children.name: Breakbeat Hardcore
children.description: Originated from the combination of sampled breakbeats and energetic rhythms with the "rave" influences set by early-1990s Techno and Acid House, including upbeat "stab" riffing and sample-based production.

children.name: Breakbeat Hardcore
children.description: Originated from the combination of sampled breakbeats and energetic rhythms with the "rave" influences set by early-1990s Techno and Acid House, including upbeat "stab" riffing and sample-based production.

children.name: Breakbeat Kota
children.description: Indonesian style that slows down the syncopated rhythms of Funkot to moderate tempos around 130 BPM.

children.name: Breakbeat Kota
children.description: Indonesian style that slows down the syncopated rhythms of Funkot to moderate tempos around 130 BPM.

children.name: Florida Breaks
children.description: Developed during the mid-1990s, combining major influences of Hip Hop derivatives such as Miami Bass and Electro along with elements of 1990s Electronic Dance Music genres like House or Techno.

children.name: Florida Breaks
children.description: Developed during the mid-1990s, combining major influences of Hip Hop derivatives such as Miami Bass and Electro along with elements of 1990s Electronic Dance Music genres like House or Techno.

children.name: Funky Breaks
children.description: Merging popular 1990s breaks styles like Big Beat with major Funk and Soul elements.

children.name: Funky Breaks
children.description: Merging popular 1990s breaks styles like Big Beat with major Funk and Soul elements.

children.name: Nu Skool Breaks
children.description: Developed in the late 1990s and early 2000s; takes elements from Drum and Bass, UK Garage, and Techno.

children.name: Nu Skool Breaks
children.description: Developed in the late 1990s and early 2000s; takes elements from Drum and Bass, UK Garage, and Techno.

children.name: Progressive Breaks
children.description: Derivative of Progressive House that incorporates its lush, melodic synth leads and atmospheres into Breakbeat's syncopated and broken rhythms.

children.name: Progressive Breaks
children.description: Derivative of Progressive House that incorporates its lush, melodic synth leads and atmospheres into Breakbeat's syncopated and broken rhythms.

children.name: Psybreaks
children.description: Uses Psytrance-derived sound design, such as squelchy sounds and psychedelic effects.

children.name: Psybreaks
children.description: Uses Psytrance-derived sound design, such as squelchy sounds and psychedelic effects.

children.name: West Coast Breaks
children.description: Combines the earlier breakbeats of Hip Hop and early Breakbeat or even Miami Bass, with various 1990s Electronic Dance Music genres like Trance and Techno.

children.name: West Coast Breaks
children.description: Combines the earlier breakbeats of Hip Hop and early Breakbeat or even Miami Bass, with various 1990s Electronic Dance Music genres like Trance and Techno.
